data.title: The Jersey Trilogy (1994 - 1997)
data.meta_description: "The Jersey Trilogy," directed by Kevin Smith, is an iconic series of films set in New Jersey, known for their witty dialogue, unique humor, and relatable characters.
data.text:
Introduction

"The Jersey Trilogy," directed by Kevin Smith, is an iconic series of films set in New Jersey, known for their witty dialogue, unique humor, and relatable characters. The trilogy, starting with "Clerks" in 1994, followed by "Mallrats" in 1995, and concluding with "Chasing Amy" in 1997, captures the essence of '90s youth culture, relationships, and social commentary. These films have garnered a cult following and are celebrated for their impact on independent filmmaking.

1. Clerks (1994)

Rating: R | Duration: 1h 32min | Rating: 7.7/10 | Genres: Comedy, Drama

Parental Rating: R (Restricted. Under 17 requires accompanying parent or adult guardian)

➱ STORYLINE:

"Clerks" is a day-in-the-life comedy set in a small convenience store, focusing on two clerks, Dante and Randal, and their discussions on life, love, and the mundanities of their jobs. The film is renowned for its minimalist style and sharp, insightful humor.

➱ SEARCH SITE BY GENERAL HASHTAGS:

#Clerks

#Comedy

➱ TRIVIA:

"Clerks" was shot for a mere $27,575 and filmed at the convenience store where Kevin Smith worked, showcasing the potential of low-budget filmmaking.

➱ SIDE NOTE:

Clerks 2 is not included in what has become known as The Jersey Trilogy. However, you can view that title here.

2. Mallrats (1995)

Rating: R | Duration: 1h 34min | Rating: 7.1/10 | Genres: Comedy, Romance

Parental Rating: R (Restricted. Under 17 requires accompanying parent or adult guardian)

➱ STORYLINE:

"Mallrats" chronicles a day in the life of two best friends, Brodie and T.S., as they navigate heartbreak and friendship in a local mall. The film blends humor with romantic elements and offers a satirical look at mall culture.

➱ SEARCH SITE BY GENERAL HASHTAGS:

➱ TRIVIA:

"Mallrats" was the second film in Smith's "View Askewniverse," featuring several characters and references from "Clerks."

3. Chasing Amy (1997)

Rating: R | Duration: 1h 53min | Rating: 7.2/10 | Genres: Comedy, Drama, Romance

Parental Rating: R (Restricted. Under 17 requires accompanying parent or adult guardian)

➱ STORYLINE:

"Chasing Amy" is a more mature, introspective film in the trilogy, focusing on the complexities of love and friendship. It tells the story of a comic book artist who falls in love with a woman, challenging his perceptions of relationships and sexuality.

➱ TRIVIA:

The film is considered one of Kevin Smith's best works, praised for its thoughtful approach to sensitive topics and character development.

Additional Films in the Series

While "The Jersey Trilogy" consists of these three films, Kevin Smith continued to explore similar themes and characters in his subsequent works, further expanding the beloved "View Askewniverse." Clerks 2 is not included in what has become known as The Jersey Trilogy. However, you can view that title here.
